intro: Blitum petiolare, commonly known as the slender bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant features small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a slender, elongated pod that contains several small, round seeds.
